definitions.definition: to force out the contents of the mouth, especially saliva:
examples: Bob Ewell spat contemptuously right in the lawyer's face.

definitions.definition: to say or shout words quickly and angrily:
examples: [ + speech ] "Get out!" she spat, when Ace appeared in the doorway.

definitions.definition: If something hot, such as a fire, spits, it produces short, sharp noises and throws out little pieces.
a long, thin, metal stick put through a piece of food, especially meat, so that it can be cooked above a fire:
examples: Roast the lamb on a spit.
